intro: Scrophularia sulphurea, commonly known as the sulphur scrophularia, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It is a member of the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It has opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are hairy and often covered in a fine, yellowish bloom. Scrophularia sulphurea is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies for various ailments.
